0.title: Can I use my Twitch account?
0.content:
Yes, there are 2 ways to do this:

- Connect your account through the [Twitch](http://twitch.tv) website and then refresh the MultiQSMP page.

- Send a message in any MultiQSMP chat, and a login alert will appear.

1.title: How do I activate the chat?
1.content: At the top of each live stream, there is a small arrow. Clicking on it will open a menu with various options, including a button to toggle the chat for that live stream.

2.title: What do the variations in streamers mean?
2.content:
When the streamer is gray, it means they are offline. When there is a yellow indicator, they are online but may not be playing QSMP at the moment.

Note: To indicate whether the streamer is playing QSMP or not, tags and the game marked in the live stream are considered, so the indicator may not always be correct.

3.title: I found/have an error!
3.content: If you encounter any errors, something is not working correctly, etc., you can go to our [feedback form](https://forms.gle/ceFMBMkvyUKwxpms7) and explain your problem.

4.title: I have a suggestion!
4.content: If you want to suggest a new feature, change something, or anything like that, you can go to our [feedback form](https://forms.gle/ceFMBMkvyUKwxpms7) and submit your suggestion.

5.title: I want to contribute to the project, how can I do that?
5.content: If you program and want to help, you can fork the repositories of the [standard version](http://github.com/feeeyli/multiqsmp) and the [legacy version](http://github.com/feeeyli/multiqsmp-legacy).
